docs.lead_paragraph: Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump on Monday called for a ban on Muslims entering the United States in the most dramatic response by a candidate yet to last week's shooting spree by two Muslims who the FBI said had been radicalized.
docs.snippet: Republican presidential front-runner Donald Trump on Monday called for a ban on Muslims entering the United States in the most dramatic response by a candidate yet to last week's shooting spree by two Muslims who the FBI said had been radicalized....

headline.print_headline: Donald Trump Urges Ban on Muslims Entering United States
headline.main: Donald Trump Urges Ban on Muslims Entering United States

byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and MICHAEL BARBARO

docs.snippet: Mr. Trump called on Monday for the United States to bar all Muslims from entering the country until the nation’s leaders can “figure out what is going on” after the terrorist attacks in San Bernardino, Calif., an extraordinary escalation of ...
docs.abstract: Mr. Trump called on Monday for the United States to bar all Muslims from entering the country until the nation’s leaders can “figure out what is going on” after the terrorist attacks in San Bernardino, Calif., an extraordinary escalation of rhetoric aimed at voters’ fears about members of the Islamic faith.

headline.main: Donald Trump Calls for Barring Muslims From Entering U.S.
headline.print_headline: Trump Wants to Block Entry of All Muslims

docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump called Monday for a "total and complete shutdown of Muslims entering the United States," an idea swiftly condemned by his rival GOP candidates for president and other Republicans.
docs.snippet: Donald Trump called Monday for a "total and complete shutdown of Muslims entering the United States," an idea swiftly condemned by his rival GOP candidates for president and other Republicans....

headline.print_headline: Trump Calls for 'Complete Shutdown' on Muslims Entering US

docs.lead_paragraph: President Barack Obama's otherwise sparse schedule on Monday had a notable addition: lunch with Hillary Clinton.

docs.lead_paragraph: John Kerry has broken Hillary Clinton's marks for miles traveled and total flight time as secretary of state, the State Department indicated on its website Monday.

docs.snippet: Senator Elizabeth Warren of Massachusetts stopped short of endorsing Hillary Clinton’s presidential bid, but showed agreement with her on being against any legislation that would weaken regulation in the financial sector....
